content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Retraining is an active employment policy tool that enables individuals to obtain a qualification for a new job or to maintain an existing job. The determination of the content is based on the current qualifications, health status, abilities and experiences of a person to be retrained. Retraining is provided by the Labour Office competent according to the place of residence of the job seeker.

All necessary information can be found on the website of the Labor Office.

questions_answers.question: Will the Labour Office pay me for a retraining?
questions_answers.value: Yes, if the prescribed conditions are met.

questions_answers.question: Will the course be chosen by the employment office, or can I choose it myself?
questions_answers.value: Both are possible. If you do not know, you can ask the Labour Office for help in choosing a suitable course for you.

questions_answers.question: I chose a course that I don't enjoy. What now?
questions_answers.value: If you are a self-payer, nothing will happen and you will lose money for an unfinished course. If the retraining is paid for you by the Labour Office, you will pay the costs by yourself.
